definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
"cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 27), occurring in 原, 历, 压 etc

sentences.english: The Shipyard has pioneered an environmentally safe method of deactivating and recycling nuclear-powered ships.
sentences.chinese: 造船厂，摸索了环境安全的方法再造失核动力船舶。

sentences.english: The work was interesting and the shipyard was huge.
sentences.chinese: 工作很有意思，而且造船厂很大。
这个厂定名为东风造船厂。

sentences.english: The shipyard will launch the new boat next week.
sentences.chinese: 造船厂将于下周让新船下水。

sentences.english: Legend has it the name came from East Coast shipyard workers.
sentences.chinese: 传说潜艇三明治的名称出自东海岸造船厂工人。

sentences.english: Starships can only be produced at bases which have built shipyards.
sentences.chinese: 太空船只能在建有造船厂的基地中建造。

sentences.english: Combined with Dockyard Management it allows you to build bigger ships.
sentences.chinese: 结合造船厂管理学可以建造更大的舰船。

sentences.english: I contacted a private shipyard which also makes warships for IN.
sentences.chinese: 我联系过一家私人造船厂，它也在为印海军造过军舰。

sentences.english: The paper outlines the outfitting work at Oshima Shipbuilding CO. LTD and the inspiration to SDARI.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍了日本大岛造船厂舾装设计的具体做法。

sentences.english: Korea’s shipyards have beaten everyone through economies of scale.
sentences.chinese: 韩国的造船厂通过规模经济击败了所有对手。

definition: aircraft carrier/CL:艘[sou1]/(coll.) (fig.) sth huge/(like) a whale
aircraft carrier/abbr. for 航空母艦|航空母舰[hang2 kong1 mu3 jian4]
